note: Specialized runner - see extra_data for details

vulnerability_location.description: These functions perform an external call to whale.call.value(...) before updating the contract’s state (totalDonated), allowing the whale contract to re-enter and potentially manipulate logic before state is updated.
totalDonated is incremented without overflow checks, allowing a maliciously large cumulative donation to wrap the uint256 counter
low-level .call.value(...) used without checking the returned success flag

Using .transfer to send ETH to the winner can revert if the recipient is a contract with a reverting fallback or exceeding the 2300 gas stipend, blocking payouts and thereby causing a denial of service.
Uses blockhash(blockNumber) and msg.sender in keccak256 to generate a random number, which is predictable/manipulable by miners
Unsafe external call using low-level .call.value without checking return value and updating state after the call, leading to potential reentrancy and ignored failures
